bibl.title: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, October 17, 1922

div1.p: Latimer believes that Emilie Lawrence Reed did not support Walter Reed's work in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, October 17, 1922
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
The Sherwood
Oct. 17, 1922.
Dear Dr. Kelly:
div1.p:
I do not think I can
suggest any statement in regard
to Mrs Reed, except, perhaps some
further acknowledgment of her kind
and cordial co'operation in the
preparation of the biography.
Personally, I do not feel as if anything
more were desirable, for, pleasant
as her altitude was in that par-
ticular respect, she was not much
in sympathy with Dr. Reed's work
and sometimes I am told, harassed
him by complaints of its claims
C1
B2
upon his time.

I have lost Light of her com-
pletely for a good many years indeed,
I do not even know whether she is
living. If she is, I think she is
most likely to be in Washington
and, if so her address could prob-
ably he found in a Washington
Directory a copy of which can al-
ways be seen at the Baltimore
Sun Office. Her son is (or was)
in the U.S. Army and if he is still
in the service, the War Department
will, of course, know his present where-
abouts.

With best wishes for the success
of the new edition,
